text: The Bade (also called B.1 West Chadic) languages are a branch of West Chadic languages. They are spoken in the Borno and Jigawa States of North Nigeria. Bade is the most widely spoken Bade langauge. It is where the branch gets its name. ==Languages== The Bade languages are:Blench, Roger. 2006. The Afro- Asiatic Languages: Classification and Reference List (ms) *Duwai *Bade *Shira (†) *Ngizim *Teshenawa (†) *Auyokawa (†) † = Extinct language ==References== Category:West Chadic languages Category:Languages of Nigeria
title: Bade languages
